Reviews.Title: “Tiny, close to city centre”
Reviews.Author: Christina T
Reviews.Content: A very small hotel, not very many fascilities. But the staff was polite and helpful. Very close to everyting in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: TravellerFanatic
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from the Hotel Augustea having stayed Tuesday through to Friday. We could not believe the quality of hotel compared to a British 3 star. It was spotlessly clean and we think it may have been previously redecorated in places as the flooring throughout seemed to be new and different to the pictures (tiles throughout reception/hallway and laminate in bedroom). The bathroom also seemed to have all new tiles and the shower was lovely and powerful... as well as hot! There was also a bidet in the bathroom. The hairdryer was a bit odd and looked a bit like a hoover stuck to the wall but it seemed to do the job :) We were in room 53 and although there was traffic noise from outside this doesn't bother us as we are from London anyway and use to this! Clean towels and bedding were put in the room everyday. The furniture was a sage green in colour and very traditional with painted flowers which we felt added to the character of the hotel! All drawers and wardrobe doors worked and there was a mini fridge in the room as well which we used to keep the water cool. It is true that breakfast was limited with white bread rolls, ham, cheese, selection of pastries, cornflakes, tea, coffee and juice. However, it was all fresh. Just would have been nice to see some fruit and yoghurt as well! All in all, we had a lovely stay in this hotel and it is central to absolutely everything! We could reach the trevi fountain in 15 minutes and the colosseum in 25 :) We would definitely stay here again if we were to visit rome!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing end to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: MrMrsHill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the last leg of our Italian Honeymoon and we would never go back again. The room was dark and dingy and they had pushed two single beds together that were different heights! The bathroom smelt of sewage and the fixtures and fittings were cracked. The breakfast was very basic so we chose to eat out after the first morning. The only up side (apart from the beauty of Rome) was that when we complained we were moved to a different room which was slightly better making the stay bearable

Reviews.Title: “Basic, mouldy and over priced”
Reviews.Author: Emily W
Reviews.Content: Rome is absolutely spectacular, the hotel is situated in a great place as all of the attractions are no more than 30 mins walk away. We enjoyed our stay in Rome but were dissapointed with almost everything with Augustea. You don't get what you pay for - you get less. The rooms are pokey and breakfast is a cop out. We weren't made aware that the hotel liked you to hand in your keys when you left and went out for the day until our 2nd day here. We handed in our key regretfully. Our personal items that were left in our bathroom including bags of dirty washing, toiletries and reciepts on surfaces had been thrown away, causing us inconvenience and added costs. When this was addressed to them they did not do anything to help or even apologize just shrugged their shoulders. We purchased expensive souvineers from the Vatican City which had 'gone missing' You don't want to have to incur more costs because of their poor hospitality and poor cleaning staff. I would go back to Rome but use another hotel, extremely dissapointed - they could have easily made our stay more enjoyable but chose not to. Poor customer service Mini bar very, very expensive mould on the ceiling, shower doors dont close properly, had to clean the toilet and wash basin ourselves before using it as it was dirty. I wouldn't trust leaving our passports in the room as anything can easily be taken and with the language being a barrier you will not get your possesions back, you will be worse off financially and your trip won't be stress free. left a bitter taste in our mouths The trevi fountain, vatican, Colusseum, Forum and Emanuelle Memorial were amazing. Advise you go to Target restaurant which is round the corner, the food was pricey but delicious. Eat loads of ice cream no matter the season it's lovely! Have fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great city break”
Reviews.Author: kozzie_Lumps
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend recently and thought the hotel was great. Arrived late on in the evening and the room was ready and waiting for us. Really quick check in, although the hotel didn't have any form on life inside getting to the room was easy enough with a small case. The road you are based on was great. There are shops, restaurants and bars so plenty of choice if you dont fancy walking far. The hotel is a 10/15 minute walk away from the fountain. If you come out and turn right to the gallery and turn right again through the tunnel the fountain is down the cobbled street on your left. We did a sightseeing tour and the stops were in great location to the hotel as it stop and the station a 2 min walk away. Breakfast at the hotel was simple, tea, coffee, waters and juice were provided along with bread rolls, cornflakes and a few cake bars, but did the job. There is a mcdonalds just outside the hotel should you want something more filling. We were lucky enough to have an ensuite in the room which some didn't have. I had emailed the hotel before i travelled and requested this so might be worth doing? The hotel was dated i wont lie, but i had a great time. Its location was spot on for its price and how much time do you spend in your room really? Also the hotel will hold suitcases for you if you have a late departure.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but enough”
Reviews.Author: speedtripl
Reviews.Content: A very basic hotel in the close versinity of Roma Termini (Main train station). The location is excellent for weekend trips to Rome as you are close to all kinds of transport systems and even can walk from the hotel to the main cultural attractions. Rooms look like from the 70's and could do with an upgrade, but you are not in Rome to stay in a hotel. Breakfast is a basic as it can get i Italy, but with a town full of restaurant on your doorstep...who cares. We paid 90 Euro per night and room which was a decend value compared to other hotel options in the area. I would take my wife for a romantic stay in Rome to this hotel, but I would always go back with friends to have a fun weekend. The receptionist was funny and always good for a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Augustea - Exceptional for 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: Nick R
Reviews.Content: Great location, right near Termini Station, and within walking distance of most major Roman sites. The staff were wonderful - very helpful and informative, and seemed genuinely interested in making your stay enjoyable. Rooms have more than many 4 star hotels - A/C, fridge, TV, Safe, reasonably sized bathroom. The cold buffet breakfast is great. Overall, a great place to stay and very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Moved us to a worse hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adeyave
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, few minutes on foot from Termini Station, near Piazza Reppublica. Walking distance of main attractions and easy to find buses and metro nearby. Reception was up some stairs and we noticed that there was an out of order sign on the lift. Lovely old building and friendly welcome when we arrived (too early to check in), from a man who promised to give us a nice room. On check in we were taken to the hotel Patria down a side street. Very disappointing, basic room although clean. Friendly staff, basic breakfast, but not what I had booked.

Reviews.Title: “I WILL AVOID THIS ONE BY ALL MEANS...”
Reviews.Author: myfreerun
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Rome and as luck would have it, my Holiday agency fixed this hotel at Rome for the three of us. Apart from location ( Termini is nearby , but there are plenty of better options near Termini) there is NOTHING to recommend this hotel. If you are expecting to find a smooth transit to your room after a hard day's travel....forget it ! There is lift which accommodates either you or your luggage and goes only upto 1st floor . If you are accommodated in the better rooms housed on the 2nd floor, you need to pull your bags and everything up a steep staircase ....that's a horrible experience and I just don't know how they call it 3-star. The two guys and the breakfast-room lady are smiling and friendly, but that hardly helps with a worthless non-cooperating manager calling the shots over telephone. Sorry, take a pensione if nothing else , but avoid this one, by all means.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: etush
Reviews.Content: the location is very good, just few blocks from the train station and the turist bus stop, the staff were very friendly and helpful, our room was spacious and the bathroom clean and new but quite small. breakfast was ok but the there's only 4 or 5 tiny tables so you have to go for breakfast or very early or late otherwise u'll have to queue for a table. apart from that the hotel is fine, basically you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: zokra
Reviews.Content: I paid Eur140 for 2 nights in this hotel and thank God I didn't spend one more cent! GOOD POINTS:- - Nice staff; - Clean Laundry; - Slept peacefully every night (tough to say the truth, it was the first time ever I put a chair against a hotel bedroom door for peace of mind); - Hotel is very close to all places of interest in Rome; - Amongst other shops, there is a supermarket and a pharmacy close to the hotel which always come in useful. LESS GOOD POINTS:- - Fairly clean room; - Smell of drainage in my room (thank God I had a good body spray which I used quite a lot during my stay); - very old furniture and bathroom fittings (fixed, non-adjustable shower head for example); - Mould on bathroom ceiling; - Bedroom and bathroom window overlooked a literally spooky, dirty shaft (I kept windows, blinds and curtains completely shut during my whole stay); - No internet in my room and since I was at Rome for work I had to work with my laptop at the reception area; - Breakfast was good for my standards since I only have a bowl of cereal in the morning but very poor when compared to other hotels; - Breakfast room is tiny,only sits 4 small tables; - I don't know about the other rooms, but my room was tiny and not advisable for claustrophobic people; - In the bathroom I had to sit sideways on the toilet since the bidet was very very close to the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value, but better options available”
Reviews.Author: carrpage
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel, last minute, as it was in a central location for the big city of Rome. The taxi journey from Ciampino Airport was only 30 minutes and should be for a fixed price of €30 (check with the driver!). On arrival, Reception explained we needed to pay an additional ‘city tax’ of €2 per person per night! We found our double room was very clean, quite spacious and with good lighting. There was no bath, but a good shower, very small shower gel (not replaced) and no extras. It was fairly warm when we stayed, so at night we turned on the cool air-con. Unfortunately it didn’t work so we had to sleep with the window open and the traffic outside was very noisy. On the second night we asked the staff to look at our air-con and we were told they don’t switch them on until May! We asked for a portable fan for the night but they were all being used in other rooms. The breakfast room was tiny, there was no fresh fruit juice, nor fresh fruit, but the coffee was fine; pastries, white rolls and tea were available. All of the major sights are in walking distance. There was no queue for the Colosseum (it was free for National Heritage Week!), but there was a queue for the Vatican Musesms (but at lunchtime it was gone). The Metro we found was efficient (we used this when it rained for a bit) but it was more enjoyable experiencing all the small streets. Overall, we found this hotel to be good value, but we wouldn’t stay here again as there are plenty of hotels around this area.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: serenawaldorf88
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 4 nights and would stay again. its in a fantastic location, along a main road with shops and restaurants close by and around a 15 minute walk to the trevi and vittorio emanuele. the staff were really nice and spoke english well. the hotel is slightly old fashioned but the rooms are a good size and were very clean and the shower was always hot. good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “1-star hotel disguised as 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sabrex
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights at Hotel Augustea and were extremely dissapointed. Here's the quick and dirty: - There are NO NON-SMOKING rooms. We specifically requested a non-smoking room and got a smoking room. When asked to switch, they told me all rooms are smoking rooms. - No FREE WiFi, despite what is advertised on their web site. You have to pay $2 Euro for 20 hours using a credit card. - Wifi is extremely unreliable and spotty. The router is apparently next to the person at the counter. We were not able to get any service in our room one floor above. - The "queen" or "double" beds are two beds pushed together. - Our room facing the street was extremely noisy. I normally have no trouble falling asleep with street noise but this was extreme. - Phone in our room did not work; either that or the person at the counter does not pick up when you dial 0 repeatedly. The only plus is that the bathroom was clean. However, no hot water from the sink, only from the bath tub. I have stayed in my share of 2-5 star hotels for business and leisure. This hotel is a 1 star hotel disguised as a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and badly in need of an update”
Reviews.Author: DonnaCox
Reviews.Content: My introduction to the hotel was to be taken to the bottom of two flights of stairs to my room, and left there with my suitcase and no access to a lift. I am a single woman with a mild physical disability which makes walking and climbing somewhat difficult, so I was not impressed. My room was small and dark and if I opened the window the noise from the air-conditioner outside made sleep impossible. The staff were not friendly, breakfast was minimal and it was not a pleasant stay. The only positive was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: keen2travelasia
Reviews.Content: My family of five people stayed at Hotel Augustea, we were very surprised at how good the hotel was. We came with very low expectations because it was extremely cheap and we booked two days before. But when we got into this hotel we were greeted by friendly staff and a very large room. The room was quite clean and so big that five people had ample room, beds were comfortable too. Breakfast was okay and there was not enough room for two families but we got there in time to take most of the seats. Over all I am very impressed with this hotel but next time I would go for somewhere a little bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing but great location”
Reviews.Author: alexander-v-o
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself were mildly disappointed by this hotel and it's facilities at first impression. The interior of the room was very basic and being in the centre of town it was noisy. The bathroom only had a shower and was a fair size but felt tired and in need of refurbishment. The breakfast was really poor even by continental standards and the dining room minute and couldn't accomodate all the guests arriving down every morning. The vstaff were courtious and very helpful but couldn't help the general impression of a really budget hotel in need of TLC. Our trip was not helped by raucous guests next door. The greatest plus at the hotel was its location within walking distance of many attractions. Those that were further were available from the bus stop outside the front of the hotel and termini is within walking distance for trains.

Reviews.Title: “Lively location”
Reviews.Author: funkyanorak
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Augustea is a centrally placed city hotel convenient for Rome Termini rail station, bus network and City Tours. The 19th Century rustic building is situated on the main Via Nazionale and houses the Augustea and the Hotel Repubblica with a McDonalds restaurant beneath. The hotel has a small ‘stair well’ lift which is accessed from street level up two short flights of steps. Reception desks for both hotels are on the first floor, the Augustea to the left as you leave the lift. Reception and house staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. We were allocated a double en-suite room on the 2nd floor overlooking the busy main road and the window shutters were partially closed to reduce the traffic noise. The room itself was double glazed, had heavy drapes, and was impeccably clean and the bed comfortable. Outside the windows and shutters suffered from traffic grime. Continental breakfast was adequate taken in a small room of about half a dozen tables which could result in queues waiting for tables become vacant or place settings to share tables. Some improvements were being carried out during our brief stay and our floor had a brief power cut. The Hotel Augustea is recommended if you want a lively city centre location and are reasonably agile to manhandle luggage from street level and when the lift is busy.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and lots to see.”
Reviews.Author: woobea
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed at Hotel Augustea for 3 nights at the end of last month. The hotel was basic and very old fashioned and my first thought of the hotel wern't great i thought it was dirty but after an hour or so of being there and getting over the tiredness of the flight i came to realise that it very clean just old fashion. The hotel staff were very friendly and one member in perticular made us feel very welcome and feel like we had known him for years. Breakfast was very basic but fine for a 4 day stay. Rome itself is definatly worth a visit and my boyfriend and i had a great time looking at all the historical buildings. It was about 33-34 degrees when we were out there but if it had been a little cooler we may of done more sight seeing, we did have to walk quite a way to get to some of the attractions but it was definatly worth it. If you are just looking for a place to sleep and aren't planning on spending alot of time in the hotel, hotel augustea is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average”
Reviews.Author: ItineraryAus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and thought the room was below average and very basic, no frills and outdated. Overall cleanliness of room was not great. Room very small, breakfast average. Restaurants / cafes in this are not great. Walking distance to places ok, but we would chose to stay somewhere different or pay that little bit extra to get somewhere a bit nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Good base - great location”
Reviews.Author: traveller2009uk
Reviews.Content: Hotel Augustea is not as bad as some of these reviews are suggesting and I would recommend it. The hotel is run by a very pleasant Italian family – from arrival, they were accommodating and friendly, making general chatter and offering advice on local sights and so on. Our room was a fairly good size with a twin beds, a TV, shower room, a mini-bar fridge, dressing table and so on (my travel buddy said the only thing the room lacked was a full length mirror). There was air conditioning – and it was very effective, so much so that in the middle of the night we had to switch it off as we were rather cold. Breakfast was basic – cereal and pastries – and the breakfast room is extremely small, however ask at reception and the management will arrange for breakfast to be bought to your room every morning, which is handy. On the last two days of our stay the breakfast room was closed due to refurbishment, so we went along to the partner hotel Patria – they have a much larger breakfast room and also offer some cold meats. By far the best feature of the hotel is its location. You are within a minute walk to Metro Republica and the main Metro station, Terminim, is a five minute walk away. You are within a 20-30 minute walk of the Colesseum, Roman Forum, Tomb of the Unknown Solider and so on – you are also surprisingly close to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps, but we decided to take the more scenic route (in other words, we got lost!). The hotel is on Via Nazionale, which is a very lively street with various places to eat and drink. Some of the bars do seem a little “high street chain” like, but if you turn off one of the side roads you find some smaller, family run restaurants with very good (and cheap) food. All in all I would recommend the hotel if you are looking for a good base – it will hit the mark. However if you are looking for a hotel where you can relax and spend a good part of the day, then Augustea is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in Hotel Augustea and the partner Hotel Patria”
Reviews.Author: venusbathstravel
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at Hotel Augustea several months in advance, and confirmed it twice, but when we arrived we were told our airconditioner wasn't working and we were taken to Hotel Patria. We accepted this with good humour but things went downhill from here. We were very unhappy with the other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fab weekend at Rome!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sara4alec
Reviews.Content: I booked this holiday through Citalia with First Choice. We left on friday 7th for 3 nights. When we got to the airport its cheaper to get a bus to get into rome, you pay 1.50 euros each and the same price if you have a big suitcase then when you get on the metro you can hop on and off and its only 1 euro each and that will last you 75minutes. we got off on our stop we were surpriced with a very big and beautiful fountain, we turned left and there was our hotel and a street full of ppl shopping and stunning resturants. The hotel starts on the second floor and the manager is a funny character and will help you with your bags, the hotel rooms are a very good size and has either a small bathroom or a long bathroom (these are suite rooms) If you havent got one of these then there is a big bathroom that you can get the key to us it, you can call the hotel like i did to check what hotel room you have. There is e very small Breakfast area could fit around 16 ppl and has basic food to start the day like-Corn Flakes-Tea-Coffee-Milk-Fruit-Bread and some cakes. In this area the hotel has the best location you can walk everywhere or us the metro everywhere. We love to so much we are boking to go to this hotel again. If you have to get a taxi to ciampino airport it will onlu cost you 35 euros if you flyin into fiamincino then it will be around 5 euros more. A bit of advise you get a bus ticket from any shop you can also use this on the metro but when you have gone on the bus you must get t stamped by the machine as that way you can get fined 50 euros!!!!!!! Just keep ticket at hand to show. When you get there it will be hard to leave. Its around 4 euros and 6 euros for a beer and 6 euros to 9 euros for a pizza. Any info you need i can help you with just send me a email.

Reviews.Title: “Urk! Try somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: airedaler
Reviews.Content: Never again will I choose a hotel on the basis of its photographic advertisment. The photos show a room of reasonable size and bearable taste in decor. Imagine our surprise when we found our room was built around the main stairwell. Split level with one half consisting of an undersize double bed (I think its called a King Single here in Australia) then two steps up to a toilet and table with the television on it. No light from the outside. All of the walls were covered with bilious pink cloth that when pushed, moved in about 2 cm before contact with the wall behind was felt. One wonders what crumbling and/or damp conditions that was hiding? And it was tiny! Oh so very tiny. My wife who is usually very tolerant, patient and quiet went back to reception and pleaded to be moved to a larger room. Which was done after one night. Happily we were only there for two nights so we tolerated it. The aircon is noisy and the walls are a thin enough for you to become involved in cheering on the young couple next door as they celebrate life. The breakfast fare was rather sad and the breakfast room claustrophobic. To be fair it is situated in a terrific position within walking distance of most of Romes "must sees" and the main railway station but if you can possibly afford a few more dollars (euros) then for pitys sake do yourself a favour and find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Be wary”
Reviews.Author: Jim002
Reviews.Content: We ended up here when someone made an error in booking us into our preferred hotel nearby - the local agent found this for us and booked us in at very short notice. Though we were clearly pleased to have somewhere to stay for the night without too much trouble, some problems emerged once we had accepted the room (described as a "suite" - maybe the same as the"apartment" described in another review). 1. The major problem was that the air-conditioning did not work at night. We were therefore very hot and slept badly before the long (2-day) trip back to Australia. 2. The second one was that the room was in a sort of annex, and someone locked the door from the outside, so that we could not get out, and had to call reception to be let out. This door was the fire exit. There was another door indicated on the plan also to be used as a fire exit, but this was locked with a key which we did not have. Therefore in the event of a fire we would have been trapped - there were bars on all the windows. Since it is clear that fire regulations for hotels are very strict in Italy, this was not only potentially dangerous but also likely to be illegal. We were very unhappy about staying in a hotel where this was possiblke 3. A third problem was that the area that we were given was not private - the connecting room between bathroom and bedroom had a glass door to a public area, covered with a curtain, but which was on the OUTSIDE, so any passer-by could draw back the curtain and look in (which they did). The hotel was not up to the general standard we had expected, with narrow dingy corridors and a generally poor standard of presentation (though the room itself was OK). Cearly, this would not matter for some people and it would be reflected in the price you would pay (which was lower than the one we originally booked into), but be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: JJFB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel in March of 2008. The best aspect of this hotel is its location. The hotel is a block from the Metro, and about three blocks from Termini. It abuts the Via Nazionale, which can be noisy - but also convenient. The rooms were decent enough, and the staff quite helpful. The breakfast consisted of ham slices, cheese slices, rolls, cornetti, cereal, milk, juice, jellies and coffee. A good hotel at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellieann5
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel in a great location. There is lots to do on Via Nazionale and on the surrounding streets if you don’t feel like going too far from the hotel at night. The hotel is also in a great location for traveling around Rome- there is a very close subway stop within 1 block and a major transportation hub only 3 blocks away. I stayed with my husband, parents and grandfather for 1 week. We originally booked 2 rooms (1 for me and my husband, 1 for my parents and grandfather), but when we checked in they put all 5 of us in the ‘apartment’. I was not thrilled; as I would have preferred my own room, but the ‘apartment’ had 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms and a little pull-out bed for my grandfather. However, when we returned to the US, we found out that booking this 1 room would have saved us a lot of money over booking the 2 smaller rooms. That was somewhat disappointing, because I feel like we got the ‘bait and switch’ but expedia took care of us and gave us some credit coupons and a small refund. The overcharge was over $500. Be careful and make sure that you are getting what you paid for. As a side note- you should really watch what you pay for everywhere in Rome. I have never been ‘overcharged’ so much in any other European city- or anywhere else in the world. I don’t know what the deal was, but for 3 of our meals the waiter would throw on some mystery charge, or conveniently add up the total incorrectly. When we would bring it to their attention, they would fix it- but it was just so sneaky! I’ve never had this happen before. The breakfast was a little less than average. Every morning they had really hard rolls, glazed croissants, corn flakes, and deli ham. They had milk, pineapple and orange juices, coffee, and tea. I know European breakfasts are smaller, but this breakfast was still a bit lower than average in comparison to other European hotels that we have stayed at. The hotel clerks were nice, not overly friendly, and able to give good recommendations and advice when requested. This is the perfect balance for me- I don’t want to be your best friend, but I appreciate good advice when I ask for it. On a scale of 1-10, the beds were about an 9 in hardness (10 being the bed I slept in while in China were it actually didn’t bounce when you sat down on it- you just kinda smacked the mattress like sitting on a rock). If having a very hard bed is a deal-breaker for you- don’t stay here. My grandfather’s pull-out bed was much softer than the real beds. Because the apartment is very far from the street, noise was not a problem for us. It was very quiet. The maid service is OK. You get clean towels everyday, and they make the bed but that’s it. No picking up trash or cleaning the shower or toilet or anything. The room was very, very dusty but clean otherwise. The rooms each had a mini-fridge (which was filled with mini-bar stuff, so no room for anything else), a hairdryer (typical hotel weak voltage- bring your own if you actually need to dry hair), a little flat screen TV, and all the typical stuff of a hotel room. No alarm clocks or wakeup calls, but my mom thinks that the flat screen TV may have had an alarm setting. Overall, a good hotel at a decent price (especially if you get the rooms you paid for!). Just be careful with your money- add up your receipts and make sure that you are getting what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “great!”
Reviews.Author: snoopstergurl
Reviews.Content: i stayed here in june and for me the stay was great. i booked this hotel obviously for cost reasons and was worried that i'd wind up in a dump, but it became one of my favorites ( and we travelled around italy during this trip) the hotel is a bit of a pain to get to as it is on the second floor.when we arrived, the front desk man was very nice and accomadating to us.we lucked out and got the apartment suite, which i would recommend that you ask for if you stay here. it had its own patio that we would sit at after a lond day, bring up some beer and read our books. there was a little living area outside the actual room, and the room itself was not small and cramped. I dont know what the other rooms were like but ours was big. the airconditioner didnt work the first day which was torture, and i worried that that was the best the airconditioner would be but they fixed it the next day and it was great. the shower itself was not really effective. the shower nozzle seemed old and clogged so only 5 holes would jet water out like a car wash hose so it wasnt comfortable.the breakfast itself was very plain,they had cereal, buns,crossaints, ham,weird twinkie thing and thats it. but i was happy just having cereal but if your looking for a better breakfast, this would not be it.a big plus for this hotel is that it has internet on site.after being in eurpoe and having to search everywhere for internet, it was handy to have it readily avalible(2euro 15min) this hotel was close to alot of the attractions, close to the train station which was handy for us, and overall a really nice stay. try to get the apartment though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but no hospitality”
Reviews.Author: mightymars_man
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late June 2006 and found the location very handy, however, the front counter staff were pompous and rude, the breakfast was very very poor and served in a tiny room. The air conditioning might as well of not existed during this hot period because it made no difference. Certainly will not be staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Smelly place, uncivilised staff, so bad I didn't even stay the night.”
Reviews.Author: Ilanto
Reviews.Content: Do not trust the website, the only thing that's been renovated here is the website itself - certainly not the rooms! The only way they could have got their 3-star rating is through bribery! My experience: I saw this hotel on my company business travel website, when I called up to book I was given a much, much higher tariff than the one I was expecting. When I told them I was entitled to a special rate, they stated the one they had just quoted was indeed the "special" tariff, "just for you". So I used my company website to book at the lower price. Based on the photos on their website and the fact that it was 3-star, I expected a simple, unpretentious hotel. I do a lot of backpacking as well as business travel, so am used to a wide range of accommodation, but I was shocked to be shown to a tiny, smelly room which felt positively suffocating. I asked to see other rooms: they all looked dusty, old, unclean, with peeling wallpaper and a suffocating smell of damp and dust. I politely explained to the receptionist that I would be unable to spend the night there, and kindly asked to be given back my passport so I could leave. The receptionist seemed to take this as a personal affront, getting very agitated and going from bullying to mocking to mildly threatening, saying it was too late and I would have to stay there now that I had booked with them, that I would be unable to find another room in the whole of Rome, that I could not leave until the manager had been called, etc etc etc. I'm Italian but have lived abroad for so long that my accent may sound foreign to a Roman, however I am in no doubt that the guy's patronising attitude and language was also due to the fact that I'm female. At this point I stopped being kind and polite and raised my voice demanding my passport back, then just left. Luckily I knew another hotel 10 mins from there, a more expensive 4-star hotel, as it was past 11pm I decided to spend one night there and look for cheaper accommodation the next morning. I later learnt from Roman colleagues that Via Nazionale is not a very good area for hotels and were not surprised by my experience. Other details: to get to the Augustea you enter an anonymous-looking doorway which looks more like the entrance to a dodgy bar (or brothel); then you go up two flights of stairs covered in worn beige linoleum... definitely not 3-star standard. When I got to the lobby area, the receptionist was stretched on the sofa watching TV - I am convinced he had spent his evening leisurely passing wind because the smell of stale pooh hit me in the face -but I guess this bit of the experience was just bad luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: SAM.46
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Augustea between 22nd of July and the 5th of August 2006. My family ( 2 adults, 2 kids ) had a great time. The hotel is small ( only 20 rooms ) but we found the room was of a good size and very clean. Maid came in every day and left us an ample supply of towels. Good size bathroom also. The dining room is fun, only 5 tables but the buffet breakfast is excellent. The staff are very helpful and always there if u need them. W e could not fault the location of the hotel - only 15 mins from the colosseum and just round the corner from repubblica metro and the main termini station was only 10 mins away which was handy for all other locations. As it was july we had the benefit of Air Con which was much needed!!! The street where the hotel is located has some fab shops, excellent cafe's and restaurants and many other hotels where u could use the bar. Overall the hotel was excellent value for money and a brill location - we would all stop here again. ( as soon as possible!!)

Reviews.Title: “Too small for knomes!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for 4 nights. 3 nights at a hotel on Via Aurliea which is out of the main centre. The last night was at the Augustea. It was a big shock going from a hotel with massive rooms to a hotel with rooms where you cant even fit your suitcase in between the wall and the beds. The rooms are made for knomes its that small!! The shower is tiny and i cant imagine a tall man fitting in it. The staff werent very friendly. We arrived in the morning & left our bags at the reception. The man said once the room is ready he will put our bags in there. We came back after a day in Florence at 6pm to find our bags still in reception!! I was travelling with my friend, both 19 years old, and the staff made rude comments asking us to 'stay longer' because we are 'beautiful'. I was not happy at all. Little did they know i am a travel agent and will not let any of my clients stay here.. even if the location is good!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not all bad”
Reviews.Author: deeks
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days at this hotel, with another couple. It seems there are rooms of various sizes and configurations. We were given a comfortable 2-bedroom 2-bathroom apartment on the top floor, entered via a roof terrace. However this would not suit a person who has trouble with stairs, as the top floor is only reached by a steep narrow flight. The manager on reception appeared irascible but we soon realised it was his normal way of speaking, and he was quite helpful. Agree with comments about small size of breakfast room and the breakfast is pretty basic. But you can buy fruit from the street stalls or the supermarket nearby. Location is great - close to opera house, SM Maggiore and not far from Termini station. Bus stops immediately outside to take you downtown to other tourist sights and the Vatican. For a 3-star hotel in Rome, it met expectations.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Alaska, europe, london, san francisco, quebec, vancover
Reviews.Title: “Location Great but thats all”
Reviews.Author: Flier
Reviews.Content: Location for this hotel was great right in the middle of the shops but it was two hotels in one building. First you had to pull your bags up some stairs then up some more before you could locate the lift which only held 2 bags and one person. The gentleman on duty was friendly when we first arrived but the next day when he found out we had already pre booked our tours back in Australia he was not that helpful. Told us we should have done it here. I had a problem with a lock on my back and when I asked for some pliers was told "No". The breakfast room was so small if a few people arrived at once no room to move. The bread roll was stale and when asked for coffee my sister was told "you wait" after waiting 10 minutes she gave up. Location was the only good thing would not stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Will be staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: juliee202
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a week long stay here and thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff were very pleasant and helpful (we were given a map of the city and contact details in case we got lost), the breakfast was excellent and delivered to our room at no extra charge. The room was fully cleaned, clean towels everyday and clean bedding every few days. Our room was quiet with no traffic noise at all. Previous reviews have mentioned the lack of light and lack of a view but to be honest, what do you expect in a 3 star hotel in the centre of a busy city? Do you spend all of your holiday looking out of your hotel window? I don't! Our room was slightly on the dark side without the lights on (due to the room position - we were situated at the back of the building) but didn't have any impact on our enjoyment of our holiday. The hotel is located in a good position for all the sights. We have just booked our return visit!

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful! Never, ever stay here”
Reviews.Author: itsjohn
Reviews.Content: How to ruin a stay in Rome? Stay at this poor excuse for a hotel. The room they showed me had no natural light and a sliver of a window that looked into a pitch-black light well. As the window could barely be opened, there was no air in the room. There was also no air-conditioning in my room. When I asked at the front desk, as it is advertised with a/c, I was told 'We only turn the air-conditioning on in June - it is now only May." And it was 26C outside. When I said my room was baking hot and how would I sleep in it, I was told to sleep with the door to the hallway open. The staff were rude and unhelpful, and it was only when I called my travel agent at home was I moved to another room, despite the manager telling me the day before that they were fully booked and not one room was avaialble! Did I also mention the mould growing up the wall in my bahtroom? I HATED this place, and as a result, I didn't like Rome much either. Stay in the gutter - it would be better than this dump!
